Description: Body of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery stemmed plate; pale slip; interior: from outside, animal frieze (two hooves and possibly a thigh remaining, to right); dashes as filling ornament; below, frieze of zigzags between black bands with band in added red lined in white; to centre, alternating petals and rays separated by dots; exterior: wide black band and, near root of stem, narrow black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 35, pl. 22, no. 5a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.873)
